info.title: Lead Service
info.description: The lead helps to describe, store, update, and manage the potential interest of (and interaction with) a prospect in a certain timeframe. Leads represent a potential chance to do business.

servers.description: Example of server url is https://my1234567.crm.cloud.sap

LeadReasonforStatusqueryresponse.title: Lead Reason for Status query response

LeadReasonforStatuscreaterequest.title: Lead Reason for Status create request

LeadReasonforStatusupdaterequest.title: Lead Reason for Status update request

get.description: Specify query parameters to return desired lead entities.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Show only the first n leads.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: Search for a string within lead.

one.summary: Order leads by name in ascending order

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Indicates if count of leads to be returned.

parameters.name: $query
parameters.description: Indicates the query to be used.

400.description:
Bad Request.

The server cannot process the request due to a client error. For example, an invalid request.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

This error is caused when the request has not been applied because there are no valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description:
Forbidden.

This client error code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

500.description:
Internal Server Error.

Failed to query leads.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: Used for conflict management when a consumer tries to update a resource. This parameter checks if the state of the resource known to the client (etag) matches the state on the server and if true, allows the update to continue.
